body_content.explanation: a territory (= a large area of a country that has some local government but less independence than a province or a state) of northern Canada, whose capital city is Iqaluit:
examples: Nunavut was carved out of the Northwest Territories in 1999, giving its Inuit residents a long-sought chance for self-government.
A report by the government of Nunavut, a Canadian territory with a majority Inuit population, argued that the ban on seal products was unfair.
